text: Table 3: Surgical and medical complications of EVAR Surgical Medical Maldeployment or malposition Acute coronary of graft syndromes Arterial rupture/arterial Acute congestive cardiac dissection failure Delayed AAA rupture Acute renal failure/CIN Stent-graft limb thrombosis Arrhythmia leading to lower limb ischemia Graft migration (unusual with Respiratory infection new stent grafts) Endoleak Venous thromboembolism Rupture of iliac artery Cerebrovascular accident (commoner in women who have smaller arteries than men) Ischemia of: Spinal cord, Postimplantation kidneys, liver, bowel, legs syndrome Graft infection (very rare) Paralysis (very rare) CIN: Contrast-induced nephropathy, EVAR: Endovascular abdominal aortic aneurysm repair, AAA: Abdominal aortic aneurysm
